issue.title: Continue button not working in SMS OTP verification page
issue.body: **Describe the issue:** When using SMS OTP as second factor in an application, `Continue` button is not working in SMS OTP verification page. **How to reproduce:** 1. Create an application 2. Set the SMS OTP as second factor 3. Try to login by entering the OTP. **Expected behavior:** User should be logged in when pressing `Continue` button **Current Behaviour** `Continue` button does not respond

issue.title: Branding Page (Design > Theme Preferences) Referring Asgardeo Links in Input Placeholders

labels.name: ui
labels.description: Issues reported in the user interface of the embedded portals (Ex: Myaccount, Console)

issue.body: **Describe the issue:** The branding page in Console Theme Preferences section appears to be referencing Asgardeo links within input placeholders **How to reproduce:** Navigate to the Branding Page > Design > "Theme Preferences" section Observe the branding page, particularly the input placeholders for links. Notice that Asgardeo links are directly inserted into these placeholders. **Expected behavior:** The input placeholders should not contain hardcoded Asgardeo links.

issue.title: Incorrect user creation wizard title
issue.body: **Describe the issue:** **How to reproduce:** - Go to the Console > User Management > Users - Create a user - Enter the required details - Click next - Check the title of the modal header **Expected behavior:** **Environment information** (_Please complete the following information; remove any unnecessary fields_) **:** - Product Version: [e.g., IS 5.10.0, IS 5.9.0] - OS: [e.g., Windows, Linux, Mac] - Database: [e.g., MySQL, H2] - Userstore: [e.g., LDAP, JDBC] --- ### Optional Fields **Related issues:** **Suggested labels:**

issue.title: Incorrect validation message for the username field in the user creation wizard
issue.body: **Describe the issue:** **How to reproduce:** - Go to the Console > User Management > Users - Create a user - Enter an invalid username (a name with spaces) - Click next **Expected behavior:** **Environment information** (_Please complete the following information; remove any unnecessary fields_) **:** - Product Version: [e.g., IS 5.10.0, IS 5.9.0] - OS: [e.g., Windows, Linux, Mac] - Database: [e.g., MySQL, H2] - Userstore: [e.g., LDAP, JDBC] --- ### Optional Fields **Related issues:** **Suggested labels:**

issue.title: Email OTP as first factor does not work when configured with the Management Console
issue.body:
**Describe the issue:**
$subject
Email OTP is working when configured with the react Console.
The change in these two scenarios is that, we are creating an advanced configuration when configuring email OTP through the react Console.  The flow fails when we add email OTP as first factor via Local authentication configuration type.

can see the following error in the console:

```

	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:829)


```
Note: This is intermittent Bug
**How to reproduce:**
Add this in deploymnt.toml 
``` 
[[resource.access_control]]
context="(.*)/oauth2/authn(.*)"
secure=false
http_method = "all"
```
1. Login to console
2. Create Tradtional web Application 
3. Access the "/oauth2/authorize" endpoint.
4. Provide the necessary authorization parameters.
5. Observe the NullPointerException error. (logs)
```
curl --location 'https://localhost:9443/oauth2/authorize' \
--header 'Accept: application/json' \
--header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' \
--header 'Cookie: commonAuthId=2517b25e-6cc1-431c-953b-e1811ef4a71a; opbs=489c5328-cebe-48fe-9195-3dc911d2d6ce-v2' \
--data-urlencode 'client_id=nchcChvMvR_ZESfeebwKWmrSBkUa' \
--data-urlencode 'response_type=code' \
--data-urlencode 'redirect_uri=http://localhost:8080/oidc-sample-app/oauth2client' \
--data-urlencode 'state=random123' \
--data-urlencode 'scope=openid internal_login ' \
--data-urlencode 'response_mode=direct'
```

<img width="757" alt="Screenshot 2023-10-25 at 13 19 15" src="https://github.com/wso2/product-is/assets/39120228/60ef74ea-ebed-4355-88a2-8baaba7e0861">

**OIDC App Configs**
1st Factor Auth: User name & Password
All others are default configs

issue.title: EMAIL OTP prompts as an authentication step when proceeding with another authenticator in MFA
issue.body:
**Describe the issue:**
When MFA is enabled with `EMAIL OTP` authenticator, eventhough we used another authenticator for authentication, EMAIL OTP authentication step appears as a second step.
 

https://github.com/wso2/product-is/assets/75057725/34afbcb1-2f49-4f3c-b141-877aa1c7330a

**How to reproduce:**

1. Login to console
2. Create an application
3. Enable MFA for the application (Choose Basic, EMAIL OTP(federated authenticator))
4. Login to the application
5. Choose BAsic authenticator and proceed.

**Expected behavior:**
Authentication should be succesful and directed to the application without any authentication steps.

**Environment information** (_Please complete the following information; remove  any unnecessary fields_) **:**
 - Product Version: [IS 7.0.0-m4]
 - OS: [Mac]
 - Database: [H2]
 - Userstore: [JDBC]

---

**Related issues:**
<!-- Any related issues from this/other repositories-->
- https://github.com/wso2/product-is/issues/17072

issue.title: Userstore Password Automatically Resets When Updating Other Properties.
issue.body: **Describe the issue:** When updating another property of the user store, such as modifying Immutable Attributes in advanced properties, if the user store password is also updated simultaneously, it results in an error. Note: This issue was identified intermittently. **How to reproduce:** 1. Configure an Active Directory/ LDAP 2. Set it up as a secondary userstore 3. From your Mangement console 4. Redirect to Userstore -> Select the Userstore -> Edit -> Advanced 5. Change `Immutable Attributes` property value 6. Update the changes. **Expected behavior:** The Password Should not be updated unless it is actually changed. **Environment information** (_Please complete the following information; remove any unnecessary fields_) **:** - Product Version: [e.g., IS 5.10.0, IS 5.9.0] - OS: [e.g., Windows, Linux, Mac] - Database: [e.g., MySQL, H2] - Userstore: [e.g., LDAP, JDBC] --- ### Optional Fields **Related issues:** **Suggested labels:**

issue.title: Userstore Password Automatically Resets When Updating Other Properties.
issue.body: **Describe the issue:** When updating another property of the user store, such as modifying Immutable Attributes in advanced properties, if the user store password is also updated simultaneously, it results in an error. Note: This issue was identified intermittently. **How to reproduce:** 1. Configure an Active Directory/ LDAP 2. Set it up as a secondary userstore 3. From your Mangement console 4. Redirect to Userstore -> Select the Userstore -> Edit -> Advanced 5. Change `Immutable Attributes` property value 6. Update the changes. **Expected behavior:** The Password Should not be updated unless it is actually changed. **Environment information** (_Please complete the following information; remove any unnecessary fields_) **:** - Product Version: [e.g., IS 5.10.0, IS 5.9.0] - OS: [e.g., Windows, Linux, Mac] - Database: [e.g., MySQL, H2] - Userstore: [e.g., LDAP, JDBC] --- ### Optional Fields **Related issues:** **Suggested labels:**

comment.body:
This is not reproducible in the latest pack. 

Tried configuring an AD and changing properties through management console and react console. But the password did not get reset and the above error was not reproduced. Therefore closing this issue since it might be fixed with the latest changes.
